item.title: Lock
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Lin:

Does it really matter? Obviously walking around the block is going to take more time and you’re going to be doing more work. In the end, you end up at the same spot. The only difference is the time and the condition you’re in. I’m also not even sure what you guys were arguing about from the main post.

Doesn’t really matter anymore. It’s just annoying when people know nothing but try to act like they do.

Read full topic

item.title: Lock
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:45, topic:341909”][quote author=John459 link=topic=438322.msg3222467#msg3222467 date=1275278789]
It’s simple.

A---------------------B | | | | | | | | | | | | C---------------------D

Lets say the distance from each letter to the next is one mile.

So if you were trying to get from point A to point B and you walked from A to C to D to B you would walk 3 miles.

If you walked from A to B you would walk 1 mile.

After you end up at point B from walking three miles you would be much more tired than if you only walked one mile, which makes each way have different results.

It would be much easier and require much less work to go from point A to point B than from point A to point C to point D to point B.
[/quote]This.

[quote author=LilXCj link=topic=438322.msg3222486#msg3222486 date=1275281526]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=438322.msg3222058#msg3222058 date=1275257045]

*The dumb shit tells Davidi2 that the displacement is the length from A to B…
[/quote]Then how the hell is it the same amount of effort to go from A to C to D to B if they are all the same distance?

It’s fucking common sense. And why would you even use the work formula for something like this? Are we lifting weights? Are we working against gravity? No. We’re counting the number of steps it takes to get an answer.

If you want to count with me, you will see that one just happens to be a greater amount than another.

I’m pretty sure that even if you go from A to B
or
A to C to D to B.

You still have the same amount of work because your destination was B.
[/quote]We’re not talking about work, we’re talking about time.[/quote]
We were arguing about work the whole time. Don’t stray from the original argument.

Anyways, Davidi2 will never admit he’s wrong, so there’s no point in trying to prove that he’s attempting to play it off.

Read full topic

item.title: Lock
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:29, topic:341909”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=438322.msg3222008#msg3222008 date=1275255032]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=438322.msg3221769#msg3221769 date=1275242685]

[quote author=noobs are ftw link=topic=438322.msg3221693#msg3221693 date=1275235523]

I hate Davidi2, it actually wasnt that long ago that he was asking how to start a server, yet now he thinks he is a coding god

he doesnt even know how to add skills thats y his server is bulby cause it comes with skills
[/quote]Rofl.

I believe you are all confusing work, and perhaps displacement. You calculate work like this:

work = force * distance

Therefore, since going the long way around means longer distance, it means more work was done.

However, the end result (maybe the correct word is displacement, but it’s late and I haven’t taken physics for years) is the same either way.

The work done would be the same, since you’re multiplying a force by the same displacements.

@Davidi2: Please stop replying if you don’t know how to calculate the work done by an object, etc…
[/quote]work = force * distance
Let’s just use an arbitrary number to represent force, say 10.
Back to my city block example:
work = 10 * 1 block
work = 10 * 3 blocks

I’m pretty sure they are different?

Now back to the original problem, if you are so intent on using the work forumula, let’s use 5 for force and the distance will be the number of steps to get the answer.

Factored equation: a(a + 2) + 1 = 0
Distributed equation: a[sup]2[/sup] + 2a + 1 = 0

Now obviously given the distributed equation, you save the step of multiplying through the parenthesis, because it was already done.

Work = 5 * steps (distributed)
Work = 5 * (steps (distributed) + 1)

Using our arbitrary number (5) you can see that the work is ‘5’ more than using the distributed equation.

Wow I didn’t wanna call you a dumbass, but w=fd, with d representing displacement. Get your facts straight before trying to make a fool of me.
[/quote]And in this case, please tell me what this displacement is you dumb shit.[/quote]Not to be racist or anything but Asians > You.

Read full topic

Wow I didn’t wanna call you a dumbass, but w=fd, with d representing displacement. Get your facts straight before trying to make a fool of me.[/quote]And in this case, please tell me what this displacement is you dumb shit.
